titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Denise Duhamel Collection MSS.083
titlestmt.author: Jennifer E. Neal

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 15:15:27 -0500.

did.abstract: Denise Duhamel (1961) is an American poet and author. She attended Emerson College and Sarah Lawrence College and lived in New York City from 1985 to 1999. She has published numerous collections of poetry and won several national awards and grants, including a fellowship from the National Endowment of the Arts. Materials in this collection include books, literary journals, and periodicals published between 1983 and 2002 that include poems and essays written by Duhamel, primarily during her time in New York.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Denise Duhamel in 1997; additional materials were donated in 2003. The accession number associated with these gifts are 2000.083.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Denise Duhamel, born 1961 in Woonsocket, Rhode Island, is an American poet and author. Duhamel received a BFA from Emerson College and an MFA from Sarah Lawrence College, and lived in New York City from 1985 to 1999. She has published numerous collections of poetry and won several national awards and grants, including a fellowship from the National Endowment of the Arts. She served as the guest editor of The Best American Poetry 2013 and teaches creative writing and literature at Florida International University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Denise Duhamel Papers; MSS 083; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original order was maintained. Some materials were placed in acid-free folders at time of donation; dates were added to these folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include books, literary journals, and periodicals published between 1983 and 2002 that include poems and essays written by Duhamel, primarily during her time in New York.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Denise Duhamel, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
